results.content: The course starts on an amazing note for beginners. However, the course is too short and does not cover important topics such as testing databases, APIs, and etc. Instead of a brief lecture on how to test private methods and properties using reflection it should have covered testing the above mentioned topics.

response.content: Dear Mahdi, thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry you weren't totally happy with the course. I am planning to add some sections on those topics, once I've updated the course for the latest version of PHPUnit. I hope to have this additional content available soon. In the meantime, if you have any specific questions about these topics, or any others, please don't hesitate to ask in the Q&A section. Best wishes, Dave
response.content_html: Dear Mahdi, thank you for your feedback. I'm sorry you weren't totally happy with the course. I am planning to add some sections on those topics, once I've updated the course for the latest version of PHPUnit. I hope to have this additional content available soon. In the meantime, if you have any specific questions about these topics, or any others, please don't hesitate to ask in the Q&A section. Best wishes, Dave

results.content:
A short but very informational course that does what you need it to do, get you to understand what Unit testing is and how it is used. 

This is done in everyday corporate working world and can be the decision maker on if someone hires you for the job, or gives you a playing chip on asking for more money. 

I would differently recommend this to anyone looking to further their coding skills.

I liked this course a lot. Author has perfect pronunciation and nice voice. Each video is concise, there is no wandering around, only pure useful facts about PHPUnit Testing. This course helped me to understand disadvantages of using static methods. Also I learned how to use Mockery testing framework.
I would happy to see another courses of this talanted author!

results.content:
the content of the course was excellent. the course material was very helpful too.
i had some issues with the videos (videos went blurred or crashed). also the multiple choice questions could have been a little harder. and in the last chapters they were left out completly.

response.content:
Thank you for your feedback! I'm sorry you had problems with some of the video playback. Please contact Udemy support directly with your issue so they can help you try and resolve it.
As for the multiple choice questions, I'll look into adding some more difficult questions. The last sections were added very recently, so they don't have quizzes yet - however I'll certainly see if they will benefit from some quizzes, and if so I'll make sure some are added - I'll let you know. Thank you again for your feedback!
response.content_html:

Molto frustrante.

results.content: Another well structured course from Dave, things went a little over my head and I feel a few more Test Driven Design examples involving all the methods presented as an overall project would take this course t o the next level but thats merely my skill level wanting a bit more detail to cememnt the ideas however I look forward to implementing the methods learned going forward.

response.content: Thank you very much for your kind review and detailed feedback Darren! Presenting the methods as an overall project is an excellent idea, and is something I'm working on for the next major course update. I'll keep you informed!

results.content:
The course was good but I noticed some syntax errors on section 7, when using assertEquals, the first argument must be the expected result, and on this section we see the expected result on the second argument.

The course should also mention that we could use the Prophecies instead of the shown mocks and explain the differences between both implementations.

response.content:
Dear Artur,

thank you for your feedback! I'll make sure those syntax errors are fixed in section 7 (the assertion still works, I just got the order of the arguments wrong).

As for the alternative mocks implementation, I'll see about adding some content related to the alternatives to the inbuilt mocks.

I'll keep you informed!

Best wishes,
Dave
response.content_html:
Dear Artur,

thank you for your feedback! I'll make sure those syntax errors are fixed in section 7 (the assertion still works, I just got the order of the arguments wrong).

As for the alternative mocks implementation, I'll see about adding some content related to the alternatives to the inbuilt mocks.

I'll keep you informed!

Best wishes,
Dave

results.content: I would like to rate this course at 4.75, not perfect in the sense that this content is more into PHP unit testing as opposed to unit testing of various situation using PHP.  Application development often involves with a database. Developers have to depend on logs to sort out update conflicts, timestamps gap, multiple updates timeout, or  "database not available" when it is up and running.  Good discussion on class, objects and properties test cases.

Good discussion on class, objects and properties test cases.

I really need this at work. I am aiming to "the world of functional programming" and it is possible to do so with the php too I konw but Haskell is what I am really practicing in serious mind.

I it is time to change it. 

Thanks!

results.content:
Le cours est bien structuré et concis. Par contre on ne fait que survoler les grandes lignes du testing.

Pas d'explication sur le taux de coverage. Pas beaucoup d'exemple concret, pas de mise en situation avec des Framework comme Laravel ou Symfony. Pas d'explication sur le mock d'API ou des bases de données. Pas d'utilisation de checker de code comme php-cs-fixer ou php-sniffer

C'est un peu court, les pratiques de bases pour se lancer mais rien pour approfondir.

Comme vous pouvez le voir dans la réponse des avis le professeur est réactif :) je rajoute une demi étoile pour la réactivité et les promesses d'amélioration
results.content_html:
Le cours est bien structuré et concis. Par contre on ne fait que survoler les grandes lignes du testing.

Pas d'explication sur le taux de coverage. Pas beaucoup d'exemple concret, pas de mise en situation avec des Framework comme Laravel ou Symfony. Pas d'explication sur le mock d'API ou des bases de données. Pas d'utilisation de checker de code comme php-cs-fixer ou php-sniffer

C'est un peu court, les pratiques de bases pour se lancer mais rien pour approfondir.

Comme vous pouvez le voir dans la réponse des avis le professeur est réactif :) je rajoute une demi étoile pour la réactivité et les promesses d'amélioration

results.content: I've just watched the beginning of the course so far where the instructor clearly explains the concepts of installing php, composer, & phpunit and demos phpunit by creating an example test method and showing how the tests can be used to test code by making assertions about the output of the piece of code you are testing so you can determine if the code is running as expected.  Thanks for creating this course, and I'm looking forward learning more phpunit!

results.content: You need PHPunit 7.x for WordPress.  This course only shows how to get the most recent which at this time is 9.2.5.  I had to dig around Stack Overflow and other 3rd party resources to figure out how to get the 7.5 PHP unit volume I needed.

results.content: This course is spot on on the topic of unit tests using phpunit. Very well paced and structured. I am learning a lot about the tool Maybe I'd like some methodology about when and how to apply unit tests in general but it's probably outside the scope of this course. Update: I finished the course, and I stand by my earlier comments. it's good all the way. We even get a course on Test Driven Development so this course is very complete. Dave, the teacher is active and answers questions from the students. As a foreign language student, I must say that his diction is very easy to follow. One might wish the course was a tad longer, maybe a few more exercises, but to be fully honest, it's also very appreciable that the course is split in very short, to the point, videos with a teacher who knows what he is doing and where he is taking the students when you have a busy schedule.

response.content: Thank you so much for your kind review and detailed feedback Bruno! I do have some course updates on the way soon!
response.content_html: Thank you so much for your kind review and detailed feedback Bruno! I do have some course updates on the way soon!

results.content_html: This course is spot on on the topic of unit tests using phpunit. Very well paced and structured. I am learning a lot about the tool Maybe I'd like some methodology about when and how to apply unit tests in general but it's probably outside the scope of this course. Update: I finished the course, and I stand by my earlier comments. it's good all the way. We even get a course on Test Driven Development so this course is very complete. Dave, the teacher is active and answers questions from the students. As a foreign language student, I must say that his diction is very easy to follow. One might wish the course was a tad longer, maybe a few more exercises, but to be fully honest, it's also very appreciable that the course is split in very short, to the point, videos with a teacher who knows what he is doing and where he is taking the students when you have a busy schedule.

results.content: The course was very good and clear most of the time.  The cut and paste of the code made it go a bit to fast.  Sections 1-5 were great in terms of building upon the previous.  Sections 6-9 were a bit more tricky as previously used classes changed and you lost the build progression and had to spend too much time trading in and out code in my opinion.  But was a very good course and explained PHPUnit very well in my opinion.

response.content:
Dear Cody,

thank you very much for your review and detailed feedback, it's very much appreciated! I'll be making improvements to the course to address these very issues in the near future.

Best wishes,
Dave
response.content_html:
Dear Cody,

thank you very much for your review and detailed feedback, it's very much appreciated! I'll be making improvements to the course to address these very issues in the near future.

Dave

results.content_html: The course was very good and clear most of the time. The cut and paste of the code made it go a bit to fast. Sections 1-5 were great in terms of building upon the previous. Sections 6-9 were a bit more tricky as previously used classes changed and you lost the build progression and had to spend too much time trading in and out code in my opinion. But was a very good course and explained PHPUnit very well in my opinion.

results.content: Dave provide a good guide to PHPUnit. If you need to learn Unit Testing with PHP, this is the course that I recommend.

results.content:
Fun course. I was looking for some fundamental direction on getting an environment setup and configured for phpunit testing for my own project and am finding this is exactly the perfect course.

Moving from a primarily java/javascript/node/npm stack, much of this is new to me, but am having no problems with the learning curve.

So this became much more for me than simply learning how to use PHPUnit, I've used other unit testing frameworks in other languages that work in a similar fashion so that in itself wasn't a huge learning cure. But it gave me a better foundation/insight on how to use name spacing, how to integrate composer into my ecosystem (how'd I ever avoid using composer?) and provided me ideas on how to better organize my code, class designs and deployment strategies, 

Dave was always there to answer any questions I would have (and I had many) no matter how awkward they might have been. Nice to have a hands on instructor on Udemy. That's worth 5 stars alone. Thanks Dave, I look forward to other courses you may offer.

response.content: Thank you very much for your kind review Karl!
response.content_html: Thank you very much for your kind review Karl!

But it gave me a better foundation/insight on how to use name spacing, how to integrate composer into my ecosystem (how'd I ever avoid using composer?) and provided me ideas on how to better organize my code, class designs and deployment strategies,

Dave was always there to answer any questions I would have (and I had many) no matter how awkward they might have been. Nice to have a hands on instructor on Udemy. That's worth 5 stars alone. Thanks Dave, I look forward to other courses you may offer.

response.content:
Hi Nico, thank you for your feedback. The classes under test are pre-written as I wanted to concentrate on teaching you how to test them. So the PHPUnit code is introduced a word or line at a time, but the code under test is explained at the start of each section. This is to save time and make sure we're focusing on the actual topic of the course. I hope this helps - thank you again for your feedback.
Best wishes,
Dave
response.content_html:

This is to save time and make sure we're focusing on the actual topic of the course. I hope this helps - thank you again for your feedback.
Best wishes,
Dave
